Dear Mr. Diab:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Triestram at (616) 552-3662.

ALLEGATION:
Facility does not have a Chief Administrator that is responsible for day-to-day
operations of the facility.
INVESTIGATION:
State Director sent notification to DCWL on December 31, 2020 stating that the
Chief Administrator has been removed from her role effective immediately.
Program Director of New Hope was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 17, 2021. Program Director said she has been in her role since November
2020 and has only been provided one supervision session since her start. Program
Director said the prior Chief Administrator had been at the New Hope facility on
occasion in November 2020 and December 2020, however did not actually provide
supervision or guidance for the Program Director. Program Director said that since
December 2020 the State Director had only been at the facility one time to “check-in”
however did not have a supervision session with her. Program Director said she has
found most of her support with coworkers across the other licenses of Youth
Opportunities in order to learn and perform her job tasks.
2

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4116 Chief administrator; responsibilities.
(1) An agency shall assign the chief administrator
responsibility for the
on-site day-to-day operation of the institution and for
ensuring compliance with these rules.
ANALYSIS: New Hope has not had a Chief Administrator appointed to be
responsible for the day-to-day operation and ensuring
compliance of the rules since December 31, 2020.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, I recommend no change in the
license status.

sir_summary.summary: The investigation found that the New Hope Youth Center failed to have an appointed Chief Administrator responsible for day-to-day operations and compliance since December 31, 2020, forcing the Program Director to seek support from coworkers at other facilities instead of receiving proper supervision. The licensee is clearly responsible for this failure to assign essential leadership as required.
